reference.unstructured: The synagogue was established in the early eighteenth century, but was destroyed by Muslims in 1721. It lay in ruins for over 140 years and became known as Ha'Hurva (Hebrew for the Ruin). Rebuilt in 1864, it became Jerusalem's main Ashkenazi synagogue. SeeYehoshua Ben AriehandZvi Shilony,Pray for the Peace of Jerusalem(Jerusalem,1982),64–5[Hebrew].
Yizhak Levi (Levitze),Jerusalem in the War of Independence(Tel-Aviv,1986),110–1;Abdullah el-Tell,Memoirs of Abdullah el-Tell(Tel-Aviv,1960),40[both in Hebrew].
Benny Morris,1948: A History of the First Arab-Israeli War(Tel-Aviv,2010),191–4[Hebrew].
John Phillips,AWill to Survive(New York,1977),8.
